projects.card.description: An umbrella project supporting many smaller projects geared towards solving Natural Language Understanding. This specific repository, though, contains only the general-ideas and techniques that I've explored/stumbled upon in my pursuit towards answering the question - What does it mean to understand language?

This repository hold the work I've done towards interpreting contemporary NLP-algorithms, and identifying their limits. It contains reproduction and criticism of others' work and my work. A part of the content here is inspired by the courses CS224N (Stanford University), and COL772 (IIT Delhi).

Solutions to all the exercises in the book Stanley B. Lippman, Jose Lajoie, and Barbara E. Moo. 2012. C++ Primer (5th. ed.). Addison-Wesley Professional. As opposed to merely giving the answers to questions, I've tried to provide an explanation supplemented examples wherever possible.

This repository holds the work I've done towards understanding contemporary Deep Learning techniques. This repository involves reproduction and criticism of others' work and my work. A part of this repository is inspired by the book I. Goodfellow, Y. Bengio, and A. Courville, Deep Learning. MIT Press, 2016.

A stereo-vision system composed of two Raspberry Pi's each with an infrared camera module. The images are processed using the OpenCV library while a custom software is used for synchronizing the two cameras.
